basics.name: Nadia Lovko
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: I recently received my M.S. in Biology from Bradley University.

research experience.company: The Grace Lab at Bradley University
research experience.summary: Studied the effects of dietary supplementation serotonin precursor on stalk-eyed fly aggression and antipredation behavior
highlights: Studied and quantified insect aggression and behavioral patterns
Prepared samples for analysis using RNA extraction and micro-dissection
Learned micro-dissection techniques, fly care, and RNA extraction with the Swallow Lab at the University of Colorado â€“ Denver in Summer 2016
Analyzed insect brain serotonin levels using ELISAs
Maintained populations of stalk-eyed flies (primarily Teleopsis dalmanni), jumping spiders (Phiddipus audax and Phiddipus johnsoni), and fruit flies (Drosophila hydei)
Trained new lab members in laboratory skills and micro-dissection techniques
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk

work.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
work.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
